what: A Collection of Tools for Research at INS
title: A Collection of Tools for Research at INS
text: goal {instools} combine share functions potential use one research projects Institute Nursing Science University Basel. Please report bugs/issues, thanks!

title: A Collection of Tools for Research at INS
text: can install package GitHub :

title: A Collection of Tools for Research at INS
text: package mostly collection self-written utilities. moment following groups included: Contains ‘handy helpers’ deemed useful parametrized reports (automated reports generate e.g. participating organizations) standard color scheme unibas defined CI accessed scales plotting adding date-column dataframe saving/writing file

get number of agreement answers (defined by a cutoff) in a vector — n_agree
text: x numeric/integer vector cutoff vector defining positive answers, default = 1 binary dataset

title: get number of agreement answers (defined by a cutoff) in a vector — n_agree
text: numeric value

title: get number of agreement answers (defined by a cutoff) in a vector — n_agree
code: # usage with dichotomized vector vec <- c(0, 0, 1, 1, 1) n_agree(vec) #> [1] 3  # usage with non-dichotomized vector: vec <- c(1, 2, 3, 4, 3, 3, 4, 3, 4, 4, NA) # you need to change the cutoff n_agree(vec, cutoff = c(3,4)) #> [1] 8

get (proportion) percentage agreement of answers in a vector - 'agreement' to be defined by cutoff — prop_agree
text: x numeric vector cutoff vector defining positive answers, default = 1 binary dataset restrict_level minimum number valid answers needed display result, otherwise answer restricted set NA, default NULL (restriction)

title: get (proportion) percentage agreement of answers in a vector - 'agreement' to be defined by cutoff — prop_agree
text: numeric value 0 - 1

title: get (proportion) percentage agreement of answers in a vector - 'agreement' to be defined by cutoff — prop_agree
code: # binary vector vec <- c(0, 1, 1, 0, 0, 1, NA_real_, 1) prop_agree(x = vec, cutoff = 1) #> [1] 0.5714286  # with restriction - throws NA as not applicable prop_agree(x = vec, cutoff = 1, restrict_level = 8) #> [1] NA

title: Complete redcap usernames based on csv-filled-lists with names and email addresses — redcap_fill_username
Complete redcap usernames based on csv-filled-lists with names and email addresses — redcap_fill_username
text: which_file standard REDCap user name list filled names email addresses username_from_mail defaults FALSE. Usernames build First, Last Names. backward-compatibility.

title: Complete redcap usernames based on csv-filled-lists with names and email addresses — redcap_fill_username
text: csv-file suffix _completed.csv

title: Complete redcap usernames based on csv-filled-lists with names and email addresses — redcap_fill_username
text: Admins rights add additional users REDCap. PI data managers project responsible fill user form send via Email admin. admin fills usernames according standardized rule (handle email-adress). bulk-adding multiple users, tedious. function fills completes user names automatically saves file .csv directory supplied file.

what: Custom color and fill scales — scale_custom
title: Custom color and fill scales — scale_custom
text: Custom coloring filling functions based unique color palettes

title: Custom color and fill scales — scale_custom
code: scale_color_unibas_d(palette = "unibas", extend = FALSE, ...)  scale_colour_unibas_d(palette = "unibas", extend = FALSE, ...)  scale_fill_unibas_d(palette = "unibas", extend = FALSE, ...)  scale_color_unibas_op(   palette = "unibas",   val_names = c("good", "neutral", "bad"),   ... )  scale_colour_unibas_op(   palette = "unibas",   val_names = c("good", "neutral", "bad"),   ... )  scale_fill_unibas_op(   palette = "unibas",   val_names = c("good", "neutral", "bad"),   ... )  scale_color_unibas_div(palette = "unibas", ...)  scale_colour_unibas_div(palette = "unibas", ...)  scale_fill_unibas_div(palette = "unibas", ...)  scale_color_unibas_c(palette = "unibas", ...)  scale_colour_unibas_c(palette = "unibas", ...)  scale_fill_unibas_c(palette = "unibas", ...)

title: Custom color and fill scales — scale_custom
text: palette Name color palette extend Whether extend discrete color palette make sufficient colors levels needed ... Additional arguments passed internal scale function val_names opinionated scales, defaults "good", "neutral", "bad"

title: Custom color and fill scales — scale_custom
text: Specific functions include: scale_(color/colour/fill)_unibas_d : Discrete palette either fixed dynamically extended number shades scale_(color/colour/fill)_unibas_op\ : Discrete palette fixed colors "good", "bad", "neutral" scale_(color/colour/fill)_unibas_div : Continuous diverging color palette, must contain negative, neutral, positive values scale_(color/colour/fill)_unibas_c : Continuous color palette

title: Custom color and fill scales — scale_custom
code: library(ggplot2) library(instools) ggplot(diamonds[1:2000,], aes(x = cut, y = carat, color = cut)) + geom_point() + scale_color_unibas_d()

title: unibas ggplot theme — theme_unibas
text: ggplot2 plot theme based colors UNIBAS

title: unibas ggplot theme — theme_unibas
unibas ggplot theme — theme_unibas
text: base_theme base theme upon additional theme-specific options applied base_size Base font size, defaults 12, passed theme ... arguments passed ggplot2::theme()

title: unibas ggplot theme — theme_unibas
code: library(ggplot2) df <- data.frame(x = as.factor(1:8),                  y = c(300, 500, 600, 750, 700, 550, 450, 350))  ggplot(df, aes(x, y, fill = x)) +   geom_col() +   scale_fill_unibas_d() +   theme_unibas()
